NHS unions reach pay deal after government offers 5% rise https://news.sky.com/story/nhs-strike-action-to-be-paused-after-union-recommends-members-accept-improved-pay-offer-12835466 NHS unions have reached a pay deal with the government in a major breakthrough that could herald the end of strikes by frontline staff in England. Nurses protest during a strike by NHS medical workers, amid a dispute with the government over pay, outside St Thomas' Hospital, in London, Britain, February 6, 2023. REUTERS/Peter Nicholls

TikTok banned from UK government phones https://news.sky.com/story/uk-government-expected-to-ban-tiktok-from-work-phones-12835138 TikTok will be banned from UK government phones amid security concerns around the Chinese-owned video app, Cabinet Office minister Oliver Dowden has announced. Thu, 16 Mar 2023 09:08:00 +0000 https://news.sky.com/story/uk-government-expected-to-ban-tiktok-from-work-phones-12835138
FILE - The TikTok app logo appears in Tokyo on Sept. 28, 2020. U.S. government bans on Chinese-owned video sharing app TikTok reveal Washington...s own insecurities and are an abuse of state power, a Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson said Tuesday, Feb. 28, 2023.(AP Photo/Kiichiro Sato, File)
...
Woman who filmed stepson, 3, as he lay dying from brain injury jailed https://news.sky.com/story/leila-borrington-woman-who-filmed-stepson-3-as-he-lay-dying-from-brain-injury-jailed-for-15-years-12835351 A woman who filmed her three-year-old stepson as he lay dying from a brain injury has been jailed for 15 years for manslaughter, assault and causing grievous bodily harm. Thu, 16 Mar 2023 12:42:00 +0000 https://news.sky.com/story/leila-borrington-woman-who-filmed-stepson-3-as-he-lay-dying-from-brain-injury-jailed-for-15-years-12835351
BEST QUALITY AVAILABLE Undated handout photo issued by Nottinghamshire Police of Harvey Borrington. Leila Borrington has been jailed for 15 years at Nottingham Crown Court for manslaughter, assault and causing grievous bodily harm after she filmed her three-year-old stepson Harvey Borrington as he lay dying from a brain injury. Issue date: Thursday March 16, 2023.
...

Man tried to murder woman in 'terror act' outside leisure centre https://news.sky.com/story/cheltenham-british-man-tried-to-murder-american-woman-in-terror-act-outside-leisure-centre-court-told-12835439 A 29-year-old man from Cheltenham has appeared in court accused of attempting to murder a woman he believed was working for GCHQ. Thu, 16 Mar 2023 14:28:00 +0000 https://news.sky.com/story/cheltenham-british-man-tried-to-murder-american-woman-in-terror-act-outside-leisure-centre-court-told-12835439
The hearing took place at Westminster Magistrates' Court in central London

'Scandalous taxpayer-funded bonuses for shipyard bosses must be given back' https://news.sky.com/story/scottish-tory-leader-douglas-ross-calls-for-taxpayer-funded-bonuses-given-to-ferguson-marine-shipyard-bosses-to-be-paid-back-12835382 Nicola Sturgeon has come under fire over £87,000 paid in bonuses to managers at a shipyard despite a lack of certainty about when two over-budget and late ferries will be delivered. Thu, 16 Mar 2023 13:18:00 +0000 https://news.sky.com/story/scottish-tory-leader-douglas-ross-calls-for-taxpayer-funded-bonuses-given-to-ferguson-marine-shipyard-bosses-to-be-paid-back-12835382
Glasgow, Inverclyde. While building two ferries on contract for CalMac, Scotland's public-owned ferry company, Ferguson Marine Engineering Ltd was put into administration as costs spiralled and building was delayed. The Scottish Government nationalised the shipyard in December 2019 renaming it Ferguson Marine (Port Glasgow) Holdings to save jobs and the contract. Picture date: Tuesday May 10, 2022.
